citations.narrative:
The perimeter fence is less than 3 feet in distance from the primary enclosure for the cougar that was recently acquired.
The perimeter fence is only 22 inches from the enclosure fencing. The facility has an existing variance for their perimeter
fence, however, cougars are not included on the approval.
It's important to maintain at least 3 feet between the enclosure and the perimeter fence to ensure that the regulated
animals are protected from unauthorized persons and animals which may intend to have contact with them from outside
the fence.
The perimeter fence must be of sufficient distance from the outside of the primary enclosure to prevent physical contact
between animals inside the enclosures and animals or persons outside the perimeter fence. Such fences less that 3 feet
in distance from the primary enclosure must be approved in writing by the Administrator.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by August 2, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
The perimeter fence is less than 3 feet in distance from the primary enclosure for the cougar that was recently acquired. 
The perimeter fence is only 22 inches from the enclosure fencing. The facility has an existing variance for their perimeter 
fence, however, cougars are not included on the approval.  
It's important to maintain at least 3 feet between the enclosure and the perimeter fence to ensure that the regulated 
animals are protected from unauthorized persons and animals which may intend to have contact with them from outside 
the fence. 
The perimeter fence must be of sufficient distance from the outside of the primary enclosure to prevent physical contact 
between animals inside the enclosures and animals or persons outside the perimeter fence. Such fences less that 3 feet 
in distance from the primary enclosure must be approved in writing by the Administrator. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by August 2, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
